comments:
I am entering this bug to track the problem related to the JDT Debug JUnit 
tests failing intermittently due to NoClassDefFoundError.  

http://fullmoon/downloads/drops/N20050912-
0010/testresults/html/org.eclipse.jdt.debug.tests_macosx.carbon.ppc.html

We set vm args as per bug 106230.

Kevin added 'ProjectCreationDecorator.testBuildComplete()'. The test failed as 
follows, which indicates our test project is not built before our test suite 
runs (thus, all the No class def found errors).

output folder is empty 

junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: output folder is empty
at org.eclipse.jdt.debug.tests.ProjectCreationDecorator.testBuildComplete
(ProjectCreationDecorator.java:247)
at org.eclipse.jdt.debug.tests.DebugSuite$1.run(DebugSuite.java:53)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:552)

Have not seen these failures for some time. It seems that they were caused by a
build failure of some kind. Since creating a test that forces a full build of
the imported workspace, and waits for that build to complete, the test suite has
been running much better.
Verified the test have not failed in similar manner since full build was added.
